# What we do

* Advanced statistical modeling

* Predictive analytics and machine learning

* Data processing, cleaning, and manipulation

* Custom data science applications and software tools

* Dynamic reporting processes

* ...and more!

:::

:::

<br>

::: {.column-body style="text-align:center"}

### Guided by what works

We combine a pragmatic problem-solving approach with flexible, open-source data science tools like [R](https://www.r-project.org/about.html), [Python](https://www.python.org/about/), [Shiny](https://shiny.posit.co/) and [Quarto](https://quarto.org/) to tailor analyses and solutions to the heart of the problem, adding complexity and rigorous statistical considerations as needed.

:::

::: divider
:::

::: {.column-body style="text-align:center"}

# How we work

We use [Posit Connect Cloud](https://connect.posit.cloud/) to host applications, interactive reports, and other analytical content to make access seamless on any device (all you need is a web link). 

Project source code is stored on [GitHub](https://github.com/centralstatz/) to elicit collaboration and provide transparency and ownership over developed solutions.

[Example Application](https://01912861-8be7-59e2-215a-cdeffdd549f2.share.connect.posit.cloud/)
&nbsp;
[Example Report](https://01917bd1-d02f-6086-efe5-2b9fab13a114.share.connect.posit.cloud/)

# Meet Alex

A statistician and data scientist in Central Wisconsin, Alex has over a decade of experience learning, teaching, and doing data science work with a wide range of tools, methodologies and problem contexts. Most of [his career](https://www.zajichekstats.com/about) has been in the healthcare provider sector, both on the research and operational sides. His primary focus is on delivering genuine value through the use of statistics and open-source data science tools, and empowering others to do the same. Want to chat? [Shoot him an email](mailto:alex@centralstatz.com)!

<br>

<i>Check out his statistics blog</i> `r emo::ji("backhand index pointing right")` [zajichekstats.com](https://www.zajichekstats.com/)</i>
